Description: Is the current location safe and away from any other danger. eg fire?
Are you able to move the person to a safer location?
Call 999
Await for 999 to arrive
End
Attempt to safely move the person to another location.
Does the person appear unresponsive?
Check to see if the airway is clear
Is the airway clear?
Clear the airway. *Provide info*
Is the person breathing by themselves?
You have successfully cleared / checked the airway
Provide rescue breathing. *Provide info*
Does the person suffer from any other issues? *List problems*
End
Does the person have a weak pulse or no pluse?
Call 999 immediately
Begin chest compressions until help arrives *Provide images and info*
Is an AED (Defibrillator) availiable or nearby?
Ask a passerby or nearby person to find one while continuing chest compressions
Use the AED
Has the heart restarted?
Does the person suffer from any other issues? *List problems*
End
Is the person heavily bleeding?
If possible wear gloves
Does the blood have a dark red or bright red colour in appearance and quickly bleeding? NOT trickling
If not, the bleeding is most likelycoming from a capillary which will ususally stop on its own.
Rinse the cut if there is blood around the area.
Apply a plaster or other covering to avoid anything going into the cut.
Call 999
Rise the cut if possible and safe to do so
Cover the would with a gauze or cloth and wrap if possible
If possible elevate the bleeding part above heart level
Has the bleeding stopped?
Has the cloth become soaked through?
Do not remove the cloth and instead add more layers with continued pressure.
Does the person suffer from any other issues? *List problems*
End
Is the person breathing improperly and or choking?
Is the person unable to talk or cough?
Do not perform the Heimlich maneuver
Is the person an infant?
Ask the person if they are choking
Perform the Heimlich manuver
Does the person suffer from any other issues? *List problems*
End
Does the person have any burns?
Has the burn been caused by chemicals, electricity, heat or sunburn?
Chemicals?
Electricity?
Heat?
Sunburn?
Wash off all chemicals before treatment follow the chemicals instructions for burns. This can usually be found on the bottle
Make sure the power is off or that the person is no longer live beofre approching them
Make sure that the heat source eg stove is no longer causing more damage before treating
Make sure the person is no longer exposed to the sun beforre treating
Make sure to follow the proper procedures for removal of what caused the burn.
Along side the redness adn swelling is the burn larger than 3 inches wide or on the face hands or feet? Or is the burn become blackened and numb?
The burn should heal over time on its own
Call 999
Flush the area with cool running water for several minutes
Apply a gauze bandge and avoid damaging the skin
Does the person suffer from any other issues? *List problems*
End
Does the person have any fractures?
If possible wear gloves
Does the blood have a dark red or bright red colour in appearance and quickly bleeding? NOT trickling
If not, the bleeding is most likelycoming from a capillary which will ususally stop on its own.
Rinse the cut if there is blood around the area.
Apply a plaster or other covering to avoid anything going into the cut.
Call 999
Rise the cut if possible and safe to do so
Cover the would with a gauze or cloth and wrap if possible
If possible elevate the bleeding part above heart level
Has the person injuried their spine, head hip or pelvis?
Call 999
Do not move the person unless you are medically trained to do so.
If possible place a cold pack on the injury and elevate if possible
Does the person suffer from any other issues? *List problems*
End
